Name: Achyutananda Samanta
Quote: In a landmark judgment, the five-judge bench of the Supreme Court unanimously, partially struck down the British-era law which criminalised consensual homosexual sex in India.

Name: Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury
Quote: Asked a question in the Parliament regarding the transgender community's status in context of Right to Education, and other constitutional rights.

Name: Ajay Kumar Mishra
Quote: This resolution of ours, the concept of a "New India" by 2022, through which we will ensure that every individual has access to a proper house, toilet, gas and electricity connections, and employment opportunities- I want the government to show the same determination towards providing transgenders with proper accommodations and other amenities, especially those who don't have a home.

Name: AM Ariff
Quote: "All other Members who spoke earlier pointed it out that the Bill excludes same sex couples and the live-in couples from accessing ARTs. The Bill missed an opportunity to recommend that reproductive rights, which are internationally and constitutionally recognized as universal, be extended to live-in couples and same sex couples."

Name: Amol Kolhe
Quote: The Government of Maharashtra is planning to set up a Transgender Board and a helpline for the LGBTQIA community. Similar approach should be adopted by the Centre to help this community.

Name: Anant Kumar Hegde
Quote: Gays and lesbians are humans just like any other individuals. It is just a sexual orientation of a few individuals and it is not possible to eliminate or remove it. We should let them live peacefully.

Name: Anubhav Mohanty
Quote: Society today is moving towards decriminalizing certain things and improving inter-personal relationships. Section 377 has been decriminalized. So, let us think beyond party lines and political agendas.

Name: Anupriya Patel
Quote: Defended the exclusion of single and gay people from having surrogate babies by saying, "A child needs a normal family, a mother and father. Live-in parents may separate."

Name: Anurag Sharma
Quote: Asked a question in the Parliament regarding the establishment of a Central Commission upon passage of the Transgender Act; the progress made in setting up similar commissions in States and UTs; and, the steps being taken by the Government in ensuring the benefits of reservations in educational institutions and government jobs for transgenders.

Name: Anurag Thakur
Quote: "Giving 1 or 2 examples of Transgenders success stories is not enough to help their community,we must do more as a society."

Name: Aparajita Sarangi
Quote: Their (transgenders') non-acceptance in the mainstream society is a gross violation of the fundamental right to equality, and also of their right to life and liberty.

Name: Arjun Ram Meghwal
Quote: The main point of my bill is that the honourable Delhi High Court's decision (to decriminalise homosexuality in 2009) is not in accordance with Indian culture.

Name: Arvind Sawant
Quote: What is this legalisation (and) non-legalisation? Only thing is that some of the things that were within the 4 walls earlier are revealed today. It's not as if - you look at the old history, and epics also, there were lesbians, there were homos, so what is that? Only thing (is that) it has been revealed, I mean, in a big way, because of the media. Relations are there.

Name: Asaduddin Owaisi
Quote: Asked a question in the Parliament regarding the number of cases and convictions under Section 377 of IPC; and whether the Government proposes to repeal or amend the same section in the light of the Supreme Court judgement recognizing the constitutional right of an individual to determine and identify one’s gender and sexual orientation.

Name: BB Patil
Quote: Asked a question in the Parliament regarding a special fund for generating livelihood opportunities for transgender community; and, the provision of reservations in educational institutions and government jobs for them.

Name: Benny Behanan
Quote: Asked a question in Parliament on the reasons to remove the manual titled “Inclusion of Transgender Children in School Education: Concerns and Roadmap” from the National Council for Education Research and Training (NCERT) website.

Name: Bhagwanth Khuba
Quote: Asked a question in the Parliament regarding transgenders' right to choose their own gender, and its impact on society.

Name: Bhartruhari Mahtab
Quote: The Bill has provision of self perceived gender identity and screening process to recognise the identity of the transgender person. But if a transgender is denied a certificate of identity by the screening committee then this Bill doesn’t provide any mechanism for appeal or review of such decision of the committee.

Name: Bhola Singh
Quote: Voted against the introduction of Shashi Tharoor's private member bill, the Indian Penal Code (Amendment) Bill, 2015, which substituted a new section for Section 377.

Name: Chandra Prakash Joshi
Quote: Raised a question in Parliament on the number of Garima Greh being run for transgender persons in the country.

Name: CR Patil
Quote: Asked questions in Parliament on whether the Government is contemplating to financially empower transgenders/ eunuchs in the country, whether the Life Insurance Corporation of India (LIC) has taken initiative to appoint such transgenders/eunuchs as its agents, and the details thereof alongwith the eligibility criterion for such appointments?

Name: D Ravikumar
Quote: The Supreme Court's ruling on IPC Section 377 states that constitutional morality is more important than social morality in any case of social discrimination.

Name: Darshana Jardosh
Quote: Voted against the introduction of Shashi Tharoor's private member bill, the Indian Penal Code (Amendment) Bill, 2015, which substituted a new section for Section 377.

Name: Dayanidhi Maran
Quote: Attended an Independence Day event in 2019, where 100 transgender persons together created a 7000 square foot tribute to Dr. B.R. Ambedkar, and raised awareness about gender issues and rights.

Name: Devaji Patel
Quote: Voted against the introduction of Shashi Tharoor's private member bill, the Indian Penal Code (Amendment) Bill, 2015, which substituted a new section for Section 377.

Name: Dilip Ghosh
Quote: Unfortunately, these 'shikhandis' are in power there. The police did nothing. It did not use its baton nor did it file an FIR, let alone firing bullets. I opposed it. Now I am being defamed. I am a patriot.

Name: Dipsinh Rathod
Quote: Voted against the introduction of Shashi Tharoor's private member bill, the Indian Penal Code (Amendment) Bill, 2015, which substituted a new section for Section 377.

Name: Diya Kumari
Quote: A remarkable step for social, economic and educational empowerment of Transgender persons, Cabinet approves The Transgender Persons (Protection of Rights) Bill 2019.

Name: DM Kathir Anand
Quote: Asked a question in Parliament on the number of transgender persons having received a vaccine under the COVID-19 vaccination drive.

Name: Dushyant Singh
Quote: I am very thankful to the Prime Minister Shri Narendra Modi ji for his vision towards rehabilitation of beggars and empowerment of the transgender community and their rights, a category of people who were never attended in past.

Name: DV Sadananda Gowda
Quote: I want to address you (transgender community) as beloved brothers and sisters but many might question me saying that we are not being treated as brothers and sisters. You should succeed in joining the mainstream and I pray to God that soon people should address you as brothers and sisters.

Name: ET Muhammed Basheer
Quote: Asked a question in the Parliament regarding various deprivations faced by the transgenders, and whether the government has any plans to ensure social justice for them.

Name: Gaurav Gogoi
Quote: As Supreme Court abolishes Section 377, one pauses to reflect on the hundreds of activists, individuals, artists, lawyers who have sacrificed so much to achieve this victory. Thank you to the Hon'ble Supreme Court for this moment. But the fight is not over.

Name: Gautam Gambhir
Quote: It’s not about being a man or a woman. It’s about being a HUMAN. With proud transgenders Abhina Aher and Simran Shaikh and their Rakhi love on my hand. I’ve accepted them as they are. Will you?

Name: Gautham Sigamani
Quote: The hon. Supreme Court has scrapped Section 377 of the IPC, but there is no provision for LGBT community, for the single women, and for those who are divorced and widows. The law should provide for surrogacy in these legalised relationships as well.

Name: Giriraj Singh
Quote:
Hinduon jaisa hijra qaum koi doosra nahi hai.

Roughly translated to: There is no nation as transgender as that of the Hindus.

Name: Gopal Shetty
Quote: See, India is a huge country. They (homosexuals) have their own problems, which can't be ignored. But you have to take everyone along with you. Sometimes, people of a particular way of thinking dominate popular discourse, and the government has no option then but to take some steps. What I believe is- they have been born, they are also human, but there are some defects in them. The status quo has existed for a very long time. This didn't happen in the Congress regime, nor in the BJP regime. This system has been prevalent in India for ages, so it should be allowed to function as it has been doing since those days.

Name: Harish Dwivedi
Quote: Asked a question in the Parliament regarding data on the number of transgenders in the country, and action plan of Central Government for their rehabilitation.

Name: Harsh Vardhan
Quote: Everybody, including gays, has human rights. It is the job of the government to protect their rights.

Name: Hasnain Masoodi
Quote: "Once we say it demolishes everywhere, we cannot have island of legitimacy here (in reference to Supreme Court striking down Section 377 of IPC and its relevance in J&K)."

Name: Hema Malini
Quote: Surrogacy has also come to the aid of people who might not be able to adopt a child perhaps because of their age or marital status. This includes the gays as well.

Name: Hibi Eden
Quote: Asked a question in Parliament on the details and number of transgender welfare boards formed under the NALSA Judgement, the number of parents of transgender children benefited from schemes for financial support, the number of transgender students who benefited from the scheme for pre-matric scholarship, and the number of transgender persons benefited from scheme for assistance for skill development and training.

Name: Imtiyaz Jaleel
Quote: Thanks a lot to the members of the trangender community who not only supported but also felicitated me after my win.

Name: Indra Hang Subba
Quote: There is nothing unnatural about them (the members of the LGBTQA+ community).

Name: Jagdambika Pal
Quote: Asked a question in Parliament on whether the Government is planning to implement a policy or scheme to accord benefits of reservation in education to transgenders in the country, whether the University Grants Commission (UGC) has issued directions to all the Universities requesting them to include a column for transgender category in all application forms/academic testimonials.

Name: Janardan Singh Sigriwal
Quote: Asked a question in Parliament on the details of States that have implemented protection for transgenders according to the guidelines set by the Government, whether the Government has given any incentive to the States complying with the guidelines and if so, the details thereof and whether the Government has fixed any deadline for compliance of the guidelines and if so, the details thereof?

Name: Jasvantsinh Bhabhor
Quote: Voted against the introduction of Shashi Tharoor's private member bill, the Indian Penal Code (Amendment) Bill, 2015, which substituted a new section for Section 377.

Name: Jayadev Galla
Quote: I had gone through the Bill and did not find a provision treating transgender as OBCs as per an earlier judgement of the Supreme Court. So, I request the hon. Minister to please consider this.

Name: Jayant Sinha
Quote: No, I would say very much that we are a government that's been in power for 60 days. These (Section 377 and sexuality) are very complicated, difficult issues.

Name: Jothimani
Quote: Respect for individual choices is a cornerstone for equality. Denial of self-expression is a type of death. The LGBT community possess rights like others.

Name: Jugal Kishore Sharma
Quote: Voted against the introduction of Shashi Tharoor's private member bill, the Indian Penal Code (Amendment) Bill, 2015, which substituted a new section for Section 377.

Name: K Muraleedharan
Quote: Was the keynote speaker for an International Day Against Homophobia, Transphobia, and Biphobia organised by Queerythm.

Name: K Subbarayan
Quote: Asked a question in Parliament on whether the Government has made an evaluation of the population of transgender in the latest census and the steps taken to make the necessary estimation of the transgender population in the country?

Name: K Sudhakaran
Quote: Proud moment to have a transgender as the National General Secretary of Mahila Congress.

Name: Kakoli Ghosh Dastidar
Quote: If we have to do justice to a transgender couple or a same sex couple, then they must be mentioned in this bill (with regards to the regulations put in the Surrogacy Bill).

Name: Kalyan Banerjee
Quote: I stand in support of the Transgender Person (Protection of Rights) Bill, 2019.

Name: Kanimozhi
Quote: Personal choices we make in our lives should not be dictated by law. Well done SC for this historic verdict.

Name: Karti Chidambaram
Quote: "This law excludes many people, rather than it includes. When I have given you so many instances of unconventional births and unconventional unions in our Hindu epics, this law only allows married people to have access to this technology. It does not allow LGBTQ people to have access to this technology."

Name: Kaushalendra Kumar
Quote: The transgender community, even today, is ostracised by the society at large.

Name: Kiren Rijiju
Quote:
1.Everybody has the right to get equal space.
2. When it comes to marriage, it needs to be discussed. India has many ancient traditions and a rich culture. There is a mixture of many religions in the country
3.“People want their chosen representatives to debate. The real power in a democracy lies with the people. These people run themselves through the medium of the constitution. There should be a widespread discussion on major issues in the country,” 
4.“State governments should also contribute and have a role. There should be a discussion about change. In a democracy, the people are the owners.”
5.“The Supreme Court will decide on such a sacred bond as marriage, or the people of India will decide. This should not be considered a government issue,”
6.“The government is not interfering in the personal life, personal activities of anybody. So there should be no confusion. When it comes to an issue related to the institution of marriage, then it is a matter of policy.”
7.“Personal freedom and personal activities of individuals of the citizens are never being disturbed, regulated, questioned by the government. You must be very clear about it. There is a clear distinction,”
8.“If any law, passed by the Parliament, is not following the spirit of the Constitution, the Supreme Court has an option to alter that, pass an adverse judgement or refer it back to the Parliament,” Rijiju argued while speaking at the India Today Conclave 2023.
9.“A person of any sex can choose to live a particular life. But when you talk about marriage, it is an institution...guided by different provisions and laws,”

Name: Kirit Solanki
Quote: This government has introduced the Transgender Person (Protection of Rights) Bill, which provides legal protection to the community.

Name: Kirron Kher
Quote: I'd like to eradicate the stereotype that men have a choice over their sexual preferences.

Name: Kirti Vardhan Singh
Quote: Voted against the introduction of Shashi Tharoor's private member bill, the Indian Penal Code (Amendment) Bill, 2015, which substituted a new section for Section 377.

Name: Krishan Pal Gurjar
Quote: For the upliftment of the transgender community, to ensure that they get their due rights, to prevent further discrimination against them, we bring to you the Transgender Persons(Protection of Rights) Bill.

Name: Kuldeep Rai Sharma
Quote: Raised a question in Parliament on the provision of reservation to transgender persons in education and employment.

Name: Lavu Sri Krishna Devarayalu
Quote: We should have provisions for the people who are having same sex relation.  Even those people want to have a baby.  Let us give them the provisions of having a baby through surrogacy.

Name: Locket Chatterjee
Quote: Gold Factory has crafted a new form of expression for the LGBT community with a range of jewellery, appropriately called "Freedom." The collection was launched by actress Locket Chatterjee who described it as a “beautiful gift” for the community.

Name: Maddila Gurumoorthy
Quote: https://loksabha.nic.in/Questions/QResult15.aspx?qref=34930&lsno=17

Name: Mahendra Nath Pandey
Quote: Voted in favour of introducing Shashi Tharoor's private member bill, the Indian Penal Code (Amendment) Bill, 2015, which substituted a new section for Section 377.

Name: Mahua Moitra
Quote: Bar Council urges SC not to hear same-sex marriage case, says 99% Indians opposed to it! Gentlemen - have you truly lost your minds? You are oath bound to protect constitutional morality, not popular sentiment. Even if 1 person’s freedom is encroached on, SC bound to hear it.

Name: Maneka Gandhi
Quote: I sincerely apologise for using the term ‘other ones’ during the debate on the  Trafficking of Persons (Prevention, Protection and Rehabilitation) Bill, 2018, in Lok Sabha. I did not ‘snigger’, I was embarrassed at my own lack of knowledge.

Name: Manicka Tagore
Quote: "Humans and animals have a difference! Discernment! #LGBT," he said in response to a homophobic tweet.

Name: Manish Tewari
Quote:
1.They (the LGBTQA+ community) are people who have a different orientation but that doesn't mean that they are not entitled to constitutional rights as any other human being.
2.How will this affidavit square up against a Constitution Bench judgement of the Supreme Court in 2018 that read down Section 377 of the IPC ?
3. Lok Sabha MP Manish Tewari said he too supported same-sex marriage in his personal capacity. “I do not speak for the Congress. My personal view as an MP is that after a five-judge Constitution Bench of the Supreme Court read down Section 377 of the IPC unanimously… there is no criminality if people of the same sex cohabit. Under those circumstances, a law that legalises that relationship should be a natural corollary,”

Name: Manoj Rajoria
Quote: Voted against the introduction of Shashi Tharoor's private member bill, the Indian Penal Code (Amendment) Bill, 2015, which substituted a new section for Section 377.

Name: Manoj Tiwari
Quote: उन्होंने एक बात कही थी, अब सुनने में अजीब सा लगता ह, लेकिन हमें अपने मन में उस शब्द के प्रति जो भाव है, उसे बदलना पड़ेगा, कि हिजडा संस्कृती को संरक्षित करने की आवश्यकता है।

Name: Meenakshi Lekhi
Quote: I welcome the decision of the court because it is important that Section 377 remains. It is not only women who can be exploited and harassed but men also get exploited so there is a need for a law to protect men too.

Name: MK Raghavan
Quote:
The definition of ‘gender’ also needs elucidation. This has not been
properly defined anywhere in the (Code of Wages) Act. In fact, all the three, that is male, female, and transgender, should be included.

Name: Mukesh Rajput
Quote: Voted against the introduction of Shashi Tharoor's private member bill, the Indian Penal Code (Amendment) Bill, 2015, which substituted a new section for Section 377.

Name: Naranbhai Kachhadia
Quote: Does the government plan to amend Section 377 of IPC for transgender rights?

Name: Narendra Modi
Quote: Humanity is not confined to male or female. We are giving a social status to them. Go and meet them. Have meetings and rallies of such people.

Name: Nayab Singh
Quote: Asked a question in Parliament on whether the Government has taken any steps to encourage the representation and participation of transgender persons in the decision making of Panchayats.

Name: Niranjan Jyoti
Quote: Voted against the introduction of Shashi Tharoor's private member bill, the Indian Penal Code (Amendment) Bill, 2015, which substituted a new section for Section 377.

Name: Nishikant Dubey
Quote: वे ज़बर्दस्ती आते हैं, हम तो उसको बुलाते नहीं हैं। इस हाउस में बोलने के लिए बहुत लोग हैं।  एक आदमी बताइए जो उनको बुलाते हैं कि हमारे यहाँ शादी हो रही है, आप आइए, हमारे यहाँ विवाह हो रहा है, आप आइए, हमारे यहाँ सत्यनारायण व्रत कथा हो रही है, आइए।

Name: Nitin Gadkari
Quote: Even a transgender would bear children but an irrigation scheme in Maharashtra's Sangli district would never be completed.

Name: NK Premachandran
Quote: Tiruchi Siva's Rajya Sabha bill on transgender rights was pushed in the Lok Sabha by three members – Shobha Karandlaje of BJP, NK Premachandran of Revolutionary Socialist Party and Baijayant Panda of Biju Janata Dal.

Name: Om Birla
Quote: Voted against the introduction of Shashi Tharoor's private member bill, the Indian Penal Code (Amendment) Bill, 2015, which substituted a new section for Section 377.

Name: Parvesh Verma
Quote: Asked a question in Parliament on the ‘Samta Nyay Kendra’, recently inaugurated as a centre for providing legal awareness, training and services to the transgender community.

Name: PC Mohan
Quote: Asked a question on shelter homes for transgender children in Parliament.

Name: Pinaki Misra
Quote: The 2012 judgement, by which the Delhi High Court in a very bold move struck down (IPC section) 377, was set aside by the Supreme Court in the 2013 judgement on the grounds that it is the job of the legislature to do away with it, and it is not the job of the court to legislate ... You must give succour to crores of people. Now the number is not in lakhs. The number is in crores.

Name: Poonam Mahajan
Quote: Happiness all around as Equality prevails again! #Section377

Name: Poonamben Maadam
Quote: Our Hon'ble PM Modi recently told his party MPs to reach out to the transgender community in their respective constituencies. This is possibly the first time the BJP leader has reached out to the community, often ostracized by society and shut out from jobs and education opportunities.

Name: PP Chaudhary
Quote: Asked a question in Parliament on the population of the transgender community/citizens in the country, State-wise, along with the details in respect of Rajasthan; the funds allocated for the welfare of the transgender community during the last three years along with the details of funds disbursed and beneficiaries under these Schemes, State-wise and area-wise for Rajasthan; whether the Government is considering any proposal to provide training to the people of transgender community under Skill India Mission or through various other channels for enabling their empowerment.

Name: PR Natarajan
Quote: Asked a question in Parliament on the number of transgender persons in the country, whether the Government is aware that such transgenders have no right to education, employment, ration card and civil rights etc; if so, the action plan of the Government for the rehabilitation of these socially segregated people; whether the Government proposes to bring a legislation to legitimatize the very existence of these transgenders.

Name: Prahlad Singh Patel
Quote: Raised an objection to the Hindi translation of "transgender" in the Rights of Transgenders Persons Bill, 2014, saying it was contrary to the spirit of the NALSA judgement of Supreme Court.

Name: Pralhad Joshi
Quote: Asked the Health ministry whether the Government has taken note of stigma and discrimination being faced by the transgender individuals while accessing healthcare services in the country; the details thereof along with the action taken/proposed to be taken by the Government to address the issue; whether the doctors and other medical personnel receive any specialised training to deal with the medical cases of the transgender individuals with increased sensitivity in the country.

Name: Prasun Banerjee
Quote: Asked in Parliament whether the Ministry has considered the repealing of Section 377 of Indian Penal Code (IPC) during its consideration for amendments in the wake of the incident of 2012 gang rape in Delhi.

Name: Pratap Simha
Quote: I know where you are going with this question. I don’t want to take a stand on these issues during election time. In fact, I don’t want to go ahead with this interview. I am here to address people’s problems and not to talk about who is living with who...

Name: Pratima Mondal
Quote: In 2014, the Supreme Court of India accorded ‘Third Gender’ status to transgender people and an individual's right to determine the gender they want to identify with. The verdict also included a directive for separate toilets for transgender individuals in public places including hospitals. But we hardly come across these toilets in public and finding a gender-neutral toilet in India is almost next to impossible. So, I would request the Government to provide necessary infrastructure so that 4.88 lakh people of our country can lead their life with normalcy and dignity.

Name: Pritam Munde
Quote: I would like to submit that the Bill for the protection and welfare of the rights of transgender people was passed during the Modi regime itself.

Name: Pushpendra Singh Chandel
Quote: Voted against the introduction of Shashi Tharoor's private member bill, the Indian Penal Code (Amendment) Bill, 2015, which substituted a new section for Section 377.

Name: Queen Oja
Quote: समझ की कमी की वजह से माता-मपता अपने ट्रान्सजेन्डर बच्चों को त्याग देते हैं। यह बिल पास होने के बाद माता-मपता अपने ट्रान्सजेन्डर बच्चों से इस तरह का व्यवहार अब नहीं करेंगे, क्योंकी अब उन्हें समाज के सवालों का जवाब देने की आवश्यकता नहीं पड़ेगी।

Name: Rahul Gandhi
Quote: I personally believe that these are matters of personal freedom. I think, I would agree more with High Court verdict.

Name: Rahul Kaswan
Quote: Voted against the introduction of Shashi Tharoor's private member bill, the Indian Penal Code (Amendment) Bill, 2015, which substituted a new section for Section 377.

Name: Rahul Shewale
Quote: In response to a question on whether he supports same-sex marriages, Rahul Shewale said, "Yes, I do."

Name: Rajesh Chudasama
Quote: It was the strong will of the Government that Lok Sabha passed many historical bills like ... the Transgender Persons (Protection of Rights) Bill. Such a new India is in the making as will provide sufficient facilities and opportunities for advancement to the poor, the Dalit, the women, the youths, the tribals and the minorities.

Name: Rajnath Singh
Quote: We support Section 377 because we believe that homosexuality is an unnatural act that cannot be supported.

Name: Rajveer Singh
Quote: Voted against the introduction of Shashi Tharoor's private member bill, the Indian Penal Code (Amendment) Bill, 2015, which substituted a new section for Section 377.

Name: Rajyavardhan Singh Rathore
Quote: Voted against the introduction of Shashi Tharoor's private member bill, the Indian Penal Code (Amendment) Bill, 2015, which substituted a new section for Section 377.

Name: Ramapati Ram Tripathi
Quote: There should be more initiatives to bring the third gender into the social mainstream. Transgenders are a part of society and have the right to lead a normal life like all of us. They should also enter into the political mainstream. Education will empower them and open new avenues in life for them.

Name: Ramcharan Bohara
Quote: Asked the Social Justice ministry whether the Government is aware that a large number of eunuchs/transgenders are found begging in metropolis in the country; whether the Government has any proposal to rehabilitate and bring them into the mainstream of the society; and whether the Government has any proposal to impart skill training to the transgenders and provide educational and employment facilities to transgenders through special quota or reservation in educational institutions and Government jobs.

Name: Ramesh Bidhuri
Quote: महोदय, इस प्राइवेट मैम्बर बिल में विसंगतियां हैं क्योंकि यह समाज से उनको अलग करने की दिशा में लेकर जाता है। जैसे अलग कोर्ट बन जाए, अलग थाना बन जाए इससे वह अपने आपको अलग महसूस करेगा। मेरा निवेदन है कि जितनी विसंगतियां हैं, वह क्लियर होनी चाहिए।

Name: Ramesh Chander Kaushik
Quote: Voted against the introduction of Shashi Tharoor's private member bill, the Indian Penal Code (Amendment) Bill, 2015, which substituted a new section for Section 377.

Name: Ramesh Pokhriyal
Quote: At present there are no transgender students studying in the Central Universities, except the Indira Gandhi National Open University (IGNOU) where a total of 814 transgender students have been enrolled in the last 5 years. Also, the Central Universities of the country, which are directly under the administrative control of the Ministry of Human Resource Development (MHRD), do not have any transgender recruited to the university staff.

Name: Ramya Haridas
Quote: Even more satisfying is the change in societal attitude towards the transgender community. When I heard from my colleagues about the canteen run by transgenders at the Palakkad civil station, I felt a sense of pride, my state too is changing. These last 20 years have turned sexuality and sexism into burning, sensitive issues. It is being said that this is the fourth wave of feminism.

Name: Rattan Lal Kataria
Quote: At an Assocham Conference, he said that apart from people with disabilities, companies also need to promote representation of the LGBT community, weaker sections of society and create a conducive work environment.

Name: Raveendranath Kumar
Quote: I appreciate the hon. Minister of Social Justice and Empowerment Shri Thaawar Chand Gehlot Ji who has brought this amendment, under the auspicious and caring guidance of our hon. Prime Minister Shri Narendra Modi Ji, for providing social, economic and educational empowerment of the transgender persons in our society.

Name: Ravi Kishan
Quote: It's a big challenge for a straight guy to play gay. I'd love to play a gay character. I used to play Sita in the stage shows of Ramleela back home in Jaunpur.

Name: Ravi Shankar Prasad
Quote: There was a view that may be sexual preference is also a personal choice. Why not decriminalise it? Other issues like same-sex marriages are a separate matter. This was a purely human issue. It is a recognition of changing attitudes in India.

Name: Ravindra Kushawaha
Quote: Voted against the introduction of Shashi Tharoor's private member bill, the Indian Penal Code (Amendment) Bill, 2015, which substituted a new section for Section 377.

Name: Ravneet Singh Bittu
Quote: Voted in favour of introducing Shashi Tharoor's private member bill, the Indian Penal Code (Amendment) Bill, 2015, which substituted a new section for Section 377.

Name: Revanth Reddy
Quote: Asked in Parliament for the University-wise details of Number of Transgender students studying in various Central Universities of the country; the University-wise details of Number of Transgender Teaching Staffs in various Central Universities of the country; the University-wise details of Number of Transgender Non-Teaching Staffs in various Central Universities of the country; and the Year-wise details of steps taken during last five years to ensure increase in participation of the transgender community in the higher education.

Name: Rita Bahuguna Joshi
Quote: Asked a question in Parliament regarding the the total number of registered Transgender people and total IDs and Certificate that has been issued from the “National Portal for Transgender Persons.”

Name: Ritesh Pandey
Quote: The proposed legislation (Surrogacy Bill) uses the word ‘women’ throughout whereas access to safe abortions is critical for transgender – a Bill that the Government has just passed giving them rights as individuals – inter-sex and gender diverse persons. Therefore, I suggest that the word ‘women’ should be replaced by ‘persons’.

Name: Riti Pathak
Quote: Asked in Parliament whether the Government is aware that a large number of eunuchs/transgenders are found begging in metropolis in the country and if so, the details thereof; whether the Government has any proposal to rehabilitate and bring them into the mainstream of the society and if so, the details thereof along with the measures taken to improve the living conditions of the said community; and whether the Government has any proposal to impart skill training to the transgenders and provide educational and employment facilities to transgenders through special quota or reservation in educational institutions and Government jobs.

Name: Rodmal Nagar
Quote: Voted against the introduction of Shashi Tharoor's private member bill, the Indian Penal Code (Amendment) Bill, 2015, which substituted a new section for Section 377.

Name: S Muniswamy
Quote: Asked in Parliament whether the Government has any plan to introduce new schemes for the upliftment of transgenders and the funds allotted in this regard including in the State of Karnataka?

Name: S Senthilkumar
Quote: Self- respect marriage law should be enacted for entire India. The differently abled people and the transgenders should be given reservation in the Government setup.

Name: Sakshi Maharaj
Quote: We have accepted the slogan ‘Hum do, hamara ek’. Now these traitors are not satisfied. They have given another slogan ‘Hum do aur hamara….’ They are advocating marriage of a girl to a girl, boy to another boy. This is what the last government did. Didn’t this corrupt the mind?

Name: Sangeeta Kumari
Quote: The (Surrogacy) Bill limits the scope of the eligibility criteria.  I would request the hon. Minister to widen the scope to members of the LGBT community, to widows, to divorcees, to overseas citizens of India, and to persons of Indian origin.

Name: Sanjay Jaiswal
Quote: मैं आभारी हूं कि संविधान में जो केवल पुरुष और स्त्री के तौर पर व्याख्या हुई थी, आज हमारी सरकार ने उभयलिंगियों को सारे अधिकार देकर के, जो 72 साल की देश की गलती थी, उसको सुधारने का काम आज यह लोक सभा कर रही है।

Name: Santosh Kumar
Quote: Voted in favour of introducing Shashi Tharoor's private member bill, the Indian Penal Code (Amendment) Bill, 2015, which substituted a new section for Section 377.

Name: Satya Pal Singh Baghel
Quote: "When the anatomy of all human beings is the same, why should one group be deprived of  basic human rights available to all?"

Name: Saugata Roy
Quote: Asked a question in Parliament on whether the Government has proposed/likely to propose inclusion of third option, “transgender” in its application forms for academic programmes and whether the Supreme Court has given any direction in this regard.

Name: Saumitra Khan
Quote: Voted in favour of introducing Shashi Tharoor's private member bill, the Indian Penal Code (Amendment) Bill, 2015, which substituted a new section for Section 377.

Name: Shankar Lalwani
Quote: भाजपा से लोकसभा का टिकिट शंकर लालवानी को मिला और ऐसे में खुशी का इजहार करने किन्नर का बड़ा दल भाजपा कार्यालय जा पहुंचा। अचानक आए किन्नरों को देखकर भाजपा नेताओं ने तो पहले उन्हें नीचे ही रूकवाने की जुगत की लेकिन किन्नर तो किन्नर है और ग्रुप के साथ हो तो उन्हें रोके कौन।

Name: Shashi Tharoor
Quote: So pleased to learn that the Supreme Court has ruled against criminalising sexual acts in private. This decision vindicates my stand on Section 377 & on exactly the same grounds of privacy, dignity & constitutional freedoms. It shames those BJP MPs who vociferously opposed me in LS.

Name: Shatabdi Roy
Quote: I have interacted with transgenders. I came to know many aspects of their lives not generally known. They are facing exploitation at every level. We need to empower them by giving them their basic rights. Enacting a law takes time, so I will wait for at least two sessions to see how much is done. If their basic rights of jobs and marriage have not been addressed, I will take it up.

Name: Shatrughan Sinha
Quote:
There is hope at the end of the tunnel. May love in all shapes, forms, ways & preferences, prevail and rule!
The LGBT community, like everyone else, deserves justice and freedom to love.

Name: Shobha Karandlaje
Quote: Once criminality of #Section377 goes, so will stigma against #LGBTQ: Supreme Court. Historic!!!

Name: Shrikant Shinde
Quote: "I would like the Ministry to consider my suggestions and also focus on implementing better enforcement mechanism for trying crimes against SC/ST/OBC along with welfare of transgenders."

Name: Shrirang Chandu Barne
Quote: Voted against the introduction of Shashi Tharoor's private member bill, the Indian Penal Code (Amendment) Bill, 2015, which substituted a new section for Section 377.

Name: Smriti Irani
Quote: At present, no proposal for amendment of this (Sexual Harassment of Women at the Workplace) Act to include members of LGBTQ community within its ambit is under consideration.

Name: Sonia Gandhi
Quote: I am disappointed that the Supreme Court has reversed a previous Delhi High Court ruling on the issue of gay rights. The High Court had wisely removed an archaic, repressive and unjust law that infringed on the basic human rights enshrined in our constitution. This constitution has given us a great legacy, a legacy of liberalism and openness, that enjoin us to combat prejudice and discrimination of any kind. We are proud that our culture has been an inclusive and tolerant one. The Supreme Court also suggested another course. I hope that Parliament will address this issue and uphold the constitutional guarantee of life and liberty to all citizens of India, including those directly affected by this judgement.

Name: Srinivas Prasad
Quote: The revenue minister said Karnataka will soon go for the TN model on pension for transgenders where the monthly payment is Rs 1,000. He also said all Mythri transgenders will be eligible for the state government's Annabhagya, Yeshaswini and Asharya schemes. Prasad urged qualified transgenders to apply for jobs outsourced by the various departments.

Name: Sudarshan Bhagat
Quote: Voted against the introduction of Shashi Tharoor's private member bill, the Indian Penal Code (Amendment) Bill, 2015, which substituted a new section for Section 377.

Name: Sujay Vikhe Patil
Quote: "I would provide one suggestion to the Government that a separate board for welfare of transgenders should be constituted at the earliest and the obligations of the Government under Section 8 of the Act should be fulfiled."

Name: Sumedhanand Saraswati
Quote: Voted against the introduction of Shashi Tharoor's private member bill, the Indian Penal Code (Amendment) Bill, 2015, which substituted a new section for Section 377.

Name: Sunil Kumar Singh
Quote: Voted against the introduction of Shashi Tharoor's private member bill, the Indian Penal Code (Amendment) Bill, 2015, which substituted a new section for Section 377.

Name: Supriya Sule
Quote: This whole (Protection of Human Rights) Bill that we are discussing has to be gender neutral. It is not just about women and children. Even the LGBT group should be included. We have passed the 377 Bill here. Why are the LGBT not getting included in this?

Name: Tapir Gao
Quote: Asked a question on government schemes providing livelihood opportunities for transgender persons in the Lok Sabha.

Name: Tejasvi Surya
Quote: We must maintain a stable society with traditional, heterosexual family values, but with space for homosexuals to live their lives. #Section377.

Name: Thamizhachi Thangapandian
Quote:
1.Today marked the 11th Pride March in our city, and the first march after the overruling of Section 377. Truly monumental. #ChennaiPride
2.Have been keenly following the Contitution Bench of Supreme Court's hearing of the petitions seeking the recognition of same-sex marriage in India. I stand in full support and eagerly look forward to a positive judgement that will make India the first UN nation from Asia to do so. This will indeed be a massive victory for LGBTQIA+ rights in the world.

Name: Thol Thirumavalavan
Quote: Supported the demand for horizontal reservations for transgender persons.

Name: TR Baalu
Quote: "Sir, you should provide security to them," he said in a question regarding toilets for the transgender community.

Name: TR Paarivendhar
Quote: "I would urge upon the Union Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment to give reservations to transgender persons to uplift their livelihood and social status in society."

Name: Uday Pratap Singh
Quote: Voted against the introduction of Shashi Tharoor's private member bill, the Indian Penal Code (Amendment) Bill, 2015, which substituted a new section for Section 377.

Name: Vanga Geetha
Quote: This Bill is aimed at recognizing and protecting the rights of the transgender persons who face a lot of discrimination and disrespect in the society. They are mostly excluded from all privileges which may lead to bias and injustice to them. They are even thrown from their own families and villages. Every transgender persons shall have right to reside and be included in his household. We find that getting a residence for members of this community is the most difficult thing. The minds of the people are so prejudiced that it is very difficult to change things at the ground level.

Name: Varun Gandhi
Quote: Asked a question in Parliament on whether the Government has any proposal to establish educational institutions for transgender community in the country.

Name: Vijay Kumar Hansdak
Quote: Voted in favour of introducing Shashi Tharoor's private member bill, the Indian Penal Code (Amendment) Bill, 2015, which substituted a new section for Section 377.

Name: Vinayak Raut
Quote: Shiv Sena's Vinayak Raut said this Bill enables various welfare measures and prohibition of discrimination against transgenders and mentioned that the legislation puts emphasis on educating, skilling and making transgenders employable.

Name: Vincent Pala
Quote: Asked a question in Parliament on whether capacities of Rashtriya Kishor Swasthya Karyakram (RKSK) service providers viz. revision of modules, additional training, etc. are being built to cater to Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual, Transgender and Queer (LGBTQ) adolescents in keeping with the relevant judicial judgments in this regard.

Name: Vinod Kumar Sonkar
Quote: Voted against the introduction of Shashi Tharoor's private member bill, the Indian Penal Code (Amendment) Bill, 2015, which substituted a new section for Section 377.

Name: Virendra Kumar
Quote: इसके साथ-साथ सेना और पुलिस में इनको स्थान प्रदान करना चाहिए ताकि ये लोग आत्मनिर्भर होकर अपनी जिम्मेदारी पूरी कर सकें। जिस तरह से हम भूमिहीन लोगों को जमीन देकर कृषि करने के लिए आगे बढ़ने का अवसर प्रदान करते हैं, ऐसे ही हमारे उभयलिंगी लोग, जो कृषि कार्य करना चाहते हैं, उनको शासन के द्वारा भूमि उपलब्ध करवायी जाए ताकि वे जीविकोपार्जन के लिए आत्मनिर्भर बन सकें।
